The lineup includes five batters, two all-rounders, two spinners, and two pacers, showcasing some of the greatest cricketers India has ever produced.

Article Title: 'I flatly refused': Jay Shah on India hosting women's T20 World Cup
Article Text:
Top Picks For You Times Exclusive: New NCA will be open for Olympic sportspersons too, says Jay Shah

Bangladesh are scheduled to host the women's T20 World Cup this October and the political unrest in the country has raised security concerns, with thoughts of having a backup ready to host the tournament elsewhere if need arises. However, the Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) has outrightly rejected any possibility of India hosting the tournament.BCCI secretary, Jay Shah , visited TOI's Mumbai office on the eve of India's 78th Independence Day and confirmed India's stand during an interaction."They had asked the BCCI if we can host the event, but I flatly refused," said Shah. "We would be still in the monsoon season (this October) and next year we are going to host the ODI Women's World Cup. I do not want to give the impression that I want to host consecutive World Cups."Shah also announced that the new state-of-the-art National Cricket Academy (NCA) will soon come up on the outskirts of Bengaluru in September and will also be available to the country's Olympic athletes."We are going to make it available for Olympic sportspersons too, like Neeraj Chopra," said Shah.On the question whether India will host pink-ball Tests in the forthcoming season, Shah ruled out that possibility."No, there are no provisions," he said. "Pink-ball Tests get over within two days in India. As a result, spectators lose money, broadcasters lose money. We need to look at sentiments also. As a fan, you go to a cricket match and buy a ticket for five days, but the game gets over within two-three days. There is no refund. So I am slightly emotional in this case."
Article Summary: Bangladesh are scheduled to host the women's T20 World Cup this October. Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) has outrightly rejected any possibility of India hosting the tournament. New state-of-the-art National Cricket Academy will soon come up on the outskirts of Bengaluru in September.

Article Title: Injured Australia pacer Spencer Johnson out of Scotland, England T20Is; replaced by Sean Abbott
Article Text:
Australia T20I squad vs Scotland and England:

Spencer Johnson , the Australian fast bowler, has been sidelined from the forthcoming T20I matches against Scotland and England in the UK due to a side injury sustained while representing The Oval Invincibles in 'The Hundred' tournament.As a replacement for the injured Johnson, Cricket Australia has called up Sean Abbott to join the squad. Abbott was originally chosen to be part of the five-match ODI series against England.During his recent stint in 'The Hundred', Johnson managed to secure only two wickets in six appearances.However, he delivered an impressive spell of 1/10 in his 20 deliveries against Northern Superchargers.Since making his debut against South Africa last year, Johnson has represented Australia in five T20Is and one ODI. The young pacer, who quickly gained recognition in the BBL with Brisbane Heat, is regarded as a strong contender to replace Mitchell Starc in the T20I squad.While Starc has been given a break from the T20Is against Scotland and England, he will be available for the ODIs. Pat Cummins, on the other hand, will not be participating in the entire tour. Josh Hazlewood has been included in both the T20I and ODI squads.Sean Abbott, who has played 15 T20Is for Australia, has been somewhat unfortunate not to have represented his country more often in the format.Abbott's impressive record in the Big Bash League is unmatched, with a staggering 165 wickets to his name, making him the leading wicket-taker in the tournament's history. Additionally, he has showcased his skills in 'The Hundred', claiming nine wickets in seven appearances for Birmingham Phoenix.The T20I squad also includes promising young seamer Xavier Bartlett, who made a significant impact in international cricket last season, and the talented Nathan Ellis. The team's fast-bowling department is further bolstered by the presence of allrounders Cameron Green, Aaron Hardie and Marcus Stoinis.While the selectors are looking ahead to the next T20 World Cup, which is scheduled to take place in 18 months, they have not completely ruled out the possibility of Starc or Cummins participating in the format.Johnson's primary focus is on regaining full fitness in time for the commencement of the Australian domestic season, where he represents South Australia.Following the UK tour, Australia's next T20I assignment is a three-match series against Pakistan in mid-November. This series could provide Johnson with another opportunity to showcase his skills, as the Test players will be unavailable due to their commitments in the upcoming first Test in Perth.After the Pakistan series, Australia's T20I schedule is expected to resume in July of the following year, with a tour to the West Indies.Mitchell Marsh (c), Sean Abbott, Xavier Bartlett, Cooper Connolly, Tim David, Nathan Ellis, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Cameron Green, Aaron Hardie, Josh Hazlewood, Travis Head, Josh Inglis (wk), Marcus Stoinis, Adam Zampa.
Article Summary: Spencer Johnson has been ruled out of the T20I series against Scotland and England. Johnson suffered a side injury while representing The Oval Invincibles in 'The Hundred' Sean Abbott has been called up to the squad as a replacement. Abbott was originally chosen to be part of the five-match ODI series against England.

Article Title: 'When he was captain...': Rohit Sharma on MS Dhoni's role in shaping his career - Watch
Article Text: NEW DELHI: It was on August 15, 2020 that Mahendra Singh Dhoni announced his retirement from international in a short Instagram post.Dhoni continues to play in the IPL , where he remains a fan favorite and his leadership, cricketing acumen, and contributions to Indian cricket have earned him a legendary status in the sport.Dhoni has been responsible for grooming a lot of current cricketers in the Indian team, including Rohit Sharma , Virat Kohli , Ravindra Jadeja and Shikhar Dhawan .Dhoni was known for giving young and emerging players opportunities and backing them during tough times and played a significant role in shaping the careers of several Indian cricketers. His belief in players' abilities and his patience with them allowed many to flourish under his leadership.As MS Dhoni completes four years of retirement from international cricket, Star Sports shared a video from 2021 on their official X handle where current Indian captain Rohit Sharma talks about the role Dhoni played in shaping his career.Rohit became the second Indian captain after Dhoni to win the T20 World Cup title when India ended their ICC Trophy drought in the West Indies in June earlier this year.In the video that was filmed during T20 World Cup 2021, Rohit says, "I made my World Cup debut under him (Dhoni), which was 2007 and since then we've had a very long journey, played a lot of cricket together. His ability to just be with the youngster and encourage him, no matter what the situation of the game is, no matter what the performance of a player is, he just tries to make sure that there is enough composure around that player, the player doesn't feel insecure, and that I think is a very very important thing when the player just comes into the team. And even for a player who has played a lot of games, for him also, he might go through a bad patch, you need someone to just come around you and just pat your back and say 'hey nothing to worry about, you've got all the ability, talent and everything, just need to go out there and enjoy.' You need that kind of backing and support from your captain and that is what we all got when he was captain."Dhoni's deep understanding of the game and his ability to read match situations made him a master strategist. His field placements, bowling changes, and match tactics often caught the opposition off guard. His calmness allowed him to think a few steps ahead, planning for various scenarios in a match.Dhoni's captaincy has left a lasting impact on Indian cricket. He transformed the Indian team into a confident and formidable unit, both at home and abroad. His leadership style has influenced a generation of cricketers, and he remains a role model for captains around the world.One of India's most successful cricket captains, MS Dhoni, often referred to as "Captain Cool," led India to victories in all three major ICC tournaments : the 2007 ICC T20 World Cup, the 2011 ICC Cricket World Cup, and the 2013 ICC Champions Trophy. His leadership was characterized by a calm and composed approach, sharp decision-making, and an ability to stay cool under pressure.MS Dhoni's captaincy is characterized by calmness, instinct, strategic acumen, and a deep understanding of the game. His ability to manage pressure, take bold decisions, and back his players earned him immense respect from his peers and fans alike. Dhoni's success in international cricket and the IPL has cemented his legacy as one of the greatest captains in the history of the sport.
Article Summary: Mahendra Singh Dhoni announced his retirement from international cricket on August 15, 2020. Star Sports shared a video from 2021 where current Indian captain Rohit Sharma talks about the role Dhoni played in shaping his career. Rohit became the second Indian captain after Dhoni to win the T20 World Cup title.

Article Title: New Zealand opener Devon Conway opts for a casual contract
Article Text: NEW DELHI: For the 2024-2025 season, New Zealand opener Devon Conway has chosen to sign a casual rather than a central contract, giving him the freedom to participate in the SA20 league in South Africa in January.Conway, a native of Johannesburg, has participated in 20 Tests, 32 ODIs, and 50 Twenty20 matches since earning a spot for New Zealand in 2020.According to New Zealand Cricket ( NZC ), he will be available for all nine Black Caps matches as well as the Champions Trophy the following year, as per Reuters."The decision to move away from a central playing contract isn't one I've taken lightly, but I believe it is the best for me and my family at this present time," the 33-year-old said in a news release."Playing for the Black Caps is still the pinnacle for me and I'm hugely passionate about representing New Zealand and winning games of international cricket."In the face of rich offers from Twenty20 leagues, NZC is trying to retain their finest players for the majority of the season, and Conway is the latest in the group to be handed a casual contract, joining former captain Kane Williamson , who will also play in SA20."In the current environment it's important to have flexibility in our system to navigate some of the challenges posed by franchise cricket," said Scott Weenink, NZC chief executive.The 15-man team for the September two-match series in Sri Lanka and a single Test against Afghanistan includes Conway and Williamson.Finn Allen , another Black Caps opener, has declined a central contract, following in the footsteps of other internationals Lockie Ferguson and Adam Milne. He will be eligible for selection on a match-by-match basis.NZC indicated that two players who are still to be named will be awarded central contracts to take Conway and Allen's places.
Article Summary: New Zealand opener Devon Conway signs casual contract for 2024-2025 season. Conway will be available for all nine Black Caps matches as well as the Champions Trophy the following year. Conway joins former captain Kane Williamson who will also play in SA20 league in January.

Article Title: Lifeline for Hyderabad as Jindal Group steps forward to acquire club
Article Text:
Hyderabad FC have been troubled with players complaining of unpaid dues

PANAJI: After months of uncertainty over their future due to rising debts and multiple transfer bans, Hyderabad FC have been thrown a lifeline by the BC Jindal Group , one of India’s leading business conglomerates.Hyderabad have been troubled for more than a year now with players complaining of unpaid dues. Since January this year, at least eight players have terminated their contracts on just clauses after complaining on non-payment of salaries for multiple months.Notices to the club have not helped, leading to the departure of key players.Now, just before the August 15 deadline provided by the organisers of Indian Super League (ISL) to sort out the mess, Hyderabad have informed the All India Football Federation (AIFF) that they have executed a term sheet with the BC Jindal Group. The term sheet, a non-binding agreement that sets out the basic conditions for making an investment, was signed last week.“A term sheet has been executed for acquiring the club, but a lot of loose ends are still to be tied before the company completes the takeover,” a senior official told TOI. “The company has sought time till the end of the month to complete the deal. There will be legal and financial due diligence, and only if the diligence is completed satisfactorily, the deal will go through.”As part of the due diligence, the company will have a look at unpaid dues, besides, crucially, try and sort out the taxation issues that have dogged the club.The BC Jindal Group is one of India’s leading business conglomerates and engaged in a diverse portfolio of businesses as a manufacturer of packaging films, steel pipes, pipe fittings, power generation, cold rolled steel strips, galvanized sheets etc.Last year, Concatenate Advest, for and on behalf of BC Jindal Group with GWC Asset Holding -- an entity promoted by one of the promoters of TVS group -- as the consortium partner, had made a bid to launch a new I-League team from Delhi but backed out due to the financial terms. “Instead of a participation fee, the group wanted an equivalent amount be considered as compulsory investment into the club and football in Delhi,” said another source.Should the Jindal Group complete the takeover of Hyderabad, they will have to first clear all pending dues of players and ensure that the club can start signing players. For now, the club is “banned from registering any new players for two entire and consecutive registration periods”, which effectively means the former ISL champions cannot register players for the entire 2024-25 season.Hyderabad also do not have enough players on their roll. The club has not started pre-season training, and with the ISL set to kick off on Sept 13, less than a month away, it will be a race against time to complete the formalities and feature in this edition of ISL.
Article Summary: Hyderabad have been troubled for more than a year now with players complaining of unpaid dues. Since January this year, at least eight players have terminated their contracts on just clauses after complaining on non-payment of salaries for multiple months. Hyderabad have informed the All India Football Federation that they have executed a term sheet with the BC Jindal Group.

Article Title: Erik ten Hag says Man United not ready for season opener, but will have newcomers available
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has confirmed that new signings Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui will be available for the season opener against Fulham at Old Trafford on Friday.Despite their availability, Ten Hag expressed concerns that the team is not fully prepared for the Premier League campaign.United are starting their season with several new players who have had little time to integrate into the squad.Ten Hag commented on the situation during a press conference on Thursday saying, "It's true, it's not the pre-season where in five to six weeks you work on a team, it's very complicated.""The USA tour squad, and then we added the players (who had been at) Euros and Copa America and now new signings, and we have to make a team from it."That team is not ready, but the league starts and more managers have this problem. Still, we have some room, have some principles and we have to make a start. We can't hide, we have to deal with it."Another key player, Harry Maguire, will be part of Friday's squad after recovering from an injury that kept him out of England's Euro 2024 campaign.However, left back Luke Shaw will not be available for the match. Shaw had played in England's final three games at Euro 2024, despite dealing with a hamstring injury that had kept him out for most of the last season.Ten Hag provided an update on Shaw's condition: "He will return in the short term, it doesn't take long," Ten Hag said. "We are looking forward, of course, for Luke Shaw. A very important player for our team so we want to get him back as soon as possible but we can't force this process."Ten Hag said Mazraoui, Lisandro Martinez and Diogo Dalot can all fill in at left back.While there was plenty of speculation about Ten Hag's job last season as United finished eighth in the Premier League, the 54-year-old signed a new contract to stay at the club until 2026 after they upset Manchester City to win the FA Cup.Ten Hag has high hopes for the team this season."We know our targets, we know our direction," he said. "Now we have to integrate new players where we think they can improve the team levels and to take it from there."(Our expectations) are always very high, we want to go for trophies."
Article Summary: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag confirms new signings Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui will be available for the season opener against Fulham. Harry Maguire will be part of the squad after recovering from an injury that kept him out of England's Euro 2024 campaign. However, left back Luke Shaw will not be available.

Article Title: Tottenham suspend Yves Bissouma over laughing gas video
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou announced that midfielder Yves Bissouma has been suspended for Monday's match against Leicester after a video surfaced on social media showing him inhaling laughing gas.The 27-year-old has apologized for what he termed a "severe lack of judgement."Nitrous oxide, known as laughing gas, has been illegal for recreational use in the UK since 2023, with penalties including up to a two-year prison sentence for repeat offenders.Postecoglou addressed the situation during a pre-match press conference on Thursday."We've suspended him for Monday's game," said Postecoglou."The door is open for him and hopefully we can help him to realise the decisions he makes impact more than just him."Hopefully it allows him to make better decisions moving forward."Bissouma, who was acquired by Spurs from Brighton for £30 million in 2022, played 45 minutes in Tottenham's friendly loss to Bayern Munich on Saturday.Later that day, he posted a video on social media showing himself inhaling from a balloon."I want to apologise for these videos. This was a severe lack of judgement," said Bissouma in a statement."I understand how serious this is and the health risks involved, and I also take my responsibility as a footballer and role model very seriously."In a positive development for Postecoglou, Dominic Solanke is set to make his debut as the Premier League season kicks off this weekend.Solanke joined Tottenham from Bournemouth in a deal that could rise to £65 million, following a season in which he scored 19 Premier League goals."Thankfully it's what we expected. He's a top pro and a good guy, he's settled into the dressing room really well," added Postecoglou."Football-wise you can see he has all the attributes we need. He still needs time to fit in. He's fitting in well with the group and training. We've still got a couple of training sessions to go but he's doing well. He should be (available on Monday)."Tottenham finished fifth in Postecoglou's first season as they faded after a stunning start to the Australian's reign.The former Celtic boss believes his side are better placed to qualify for the Champions League this season."We feel a lot more settled and better prepared for what's ahead," he said."There were a lot of unknowns last year at this time. Having said all that, it didn't stop us from having a great start to the season."The pleasing thing is pretty much everyone on the list is available and that will be important for us. After the (September) international break, Europe starts and the Carabao (League) Cup, so we'll need all our players."
Article Summary: Tottenham midfielder Yves Bissouma suspended for Monday's match against Leicester. The 27-year-old has apologized for what he termed a "severe lack of judgement" Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou says Dominic Solanke is set to make his debut.

Article Title: Barcelona sensation Lamine Yamal's father stabbed; suspects in custody
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Mounir Nasraoui , father of Spanish football star Lamine Yamal , was attacked in a car park in Mataro, Catalonia on Wednesday, July 12th at approximately 19:10 GMT. The incident occurred in the Rocafonda neighbourhood, the same area where Yamal grew up.According to the Mossos d'Esquadra , the Catalan regional police force, Nasraoui sustained multiple stab wounds during the attack.He was subsequently transported to Can Ruti Hospital for medical treatment.While the hospital has not released an official statement, a source close to the family confirmed that Nasraoui is in stable condition and considered "out of danger," though he remains under observation.Law enforcement officials have apprehended four individuals in connection with the attack. Three suspects were detained on Wednesday night and are currently being questioned at the Mataro police station. A fourth individual was taken into custody on Thursday morning at approximately 09:00 GMT.The investigation into the incident is ongoing. Authorities are planning to interview the victim, Mounir Nasraoui, as soon as possible to gather his account of the events.Witness testimonies will also be crucial in piecing together the circumstances that led to the attack. Preliminary reports from the Spanish newspaper La Vanguardia suggest that a street altercation involving Nasraoui and several individuals escalated into the stabbing incident.Lamine Yamal, a rising star in the world of football, made his debut for Barcelona at the age of 15 in April 2023. He played a pivotal role in Spain's recent Euro 2024 victory, becoming the youngest player to both participate and score in the tournament's history.Yamal maintains a strong connection to his hometown of Rocafonda, where his father and grandmother still reside. He frequently celebrates goals with a "304" hand gesture, a tribute to his neighbourhood's postal code.
Article Summary: Mounir Nasraoui, father of Spanish football star Lamine Yamal, was attacked in a car park in Mataro, Catalonia on Wednesday. The incident occurred in the Rocafonda neighbourhood, the same area where Yamal grew up. Three suspects were detained on Wednesday night and are currently being questioned at the Mataro police station.

Article Title: Visit of Manchester City may provide early clues to Chelsea puzzle
Article Text: NEW DELHI: As the new Premier League season kicks off, predicting Manchester City 's performance is straightforward, but the real intrigue lies with their opening opponents, Chelsea, whose unpredictable squad under new manager Enzo Maresca is leaving fans and pundits puzzled.On Sunday, Maresca will pick his first competitive line-up following another summer of hefty spending.Chelsea has spent around 160 million pounds ($205.10 million) on new players like winger Pedro Neto from Wolverhampton Wanderers, midfielder Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall from Leicester City, and goalkeeper Filip Jorgenson from Villarreal.Since owners Behdad Eghbali and Todd Boehly took charge in mid-2022, the club has acquired around 40 players with a total spend of approximately 1.3 billion euros ($1.43 billion).Managing such a large squad proved difficult for Mauricio Pochettino for most of last season, though a strong end to the campaign hinted at the identity he was trying to build. However, Pochettino was replaced by Italian manager Maresca, and Chelsea fans are hopeful things will come together more quickly this time around."It is a complete guess but I am going to be wild and say Chelsea will sneak in, in fourth place," former Chelsea player and now BBC pundit Pat Nevin told the BBC. "If you take last season as a whole, it could be anything again this time."The visit from City, who are starting their quest for an unprecedented fifth successive English title, will certainly keep the focus sharp at Stamford Bridge.City has been quiet in the transfer window, maintaining a relatively small but experienced first-team squad of 27 players, expected once again to set a high benchmark.The corresponding fixture last season ended in a dramatic 4-4 draw in November, but Chelsea's subsequent 4-1 loss at Newcastle United demonstrated their inconsistency.While City waits until Sunday for their opener, Manchester United kicks off the season on Friday when they host Fulham.United's unexpected FA Cup final victory over City helped keep Erik Ten Hag in his job. However, the Dutchman knows he needs a strong start to the season to avoid the persistent speculation about his future that troubled him last season.While aiming for the top four, Arsenal is expected to be City's main challenger again, after coming close in the 2022-23 season and even closer last season.Arsenal begins at home against Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday, with main summer signing Ricardo Calafiori likely making his first defensive start. In addition to Maresca, several other managers will be making their competitive debut on the opening weekend.Liverpool's Arne Slot takes on the challenge of leading the club into the post-Juergen Klopp era, starting away at promoted Ipswich Town. Brighton & Hove Albion's Fabian Huerzeler kicks off his tenure against Everton, while all eyes will be on West Ham United's new manager Julen Lopetegui as his side hosts Aston Villa, who finished fourth last season.Tottenham Hotspur, who ended fifth last season, will begin their second season under Ange Postecoglou on Monday, playing away at promoted Leicester City.
Article Summary: Premier League season kicks off on Sunday with Manchester City taking on Chelsea. Chelsea has spent around 160 million pounds ($205.10 million) on new players. Manchester United kick off their season on Friday against Fulham. Arsenal begins at home against Wolverhampton Wanderers on Saturday.

Article Title: UEFA Super Cup: Kylian Mbappe strikes on debut as Madrid beat Atalanta
Article Text:
Mbappe movement

NEW DELHI: Kylian Mbappe scored on his Real Madrid debut to help his new team defeat Atalanta 2-0 and win the UEFA Super Cup for the record sixth time on Wednesday in Warsaw.After years of waiting to play for his ideal team, the French forward sensation finally joined Los Blancos this summer upon his departure from Paris Saint-Germain , and he celebrated his debut with a goal, as per AFP.After the Italian Europa League winners held their own in the first half, Fede Valverde broke the tie for the holders of the Champions League in the 59th minute with a close-range shot.Madrid started to build momentum, and in the 68th minute, Mbappe scored a spectacular goal to secure the win after Jude Bellingham had spotted his run into space in the box."It was a great night, I've been waiting for this moment for a long time," Mbappe told Movistar, speaking in fluent Spanish."To play with this shirt, with this badge, for these fans, it's a gift for me."We won a trophy too, that's very important, we know that here we always have to win and I am very happy."With Madrid's victory, head coach Carlo Ancelotti tied previous Los Blancos coach Miguel Munoz for the most titles won as a club manager with 14.This season, the Italian's first priority is creating a system that would maximize the performance of his wide range of attacking players.Initially, Mbappe started in the middle of Madrid's front line, with Vinicius Junior on the left and Rodrygo Goes on the right, giving an indication of how Ancelotti may use him this season.Consequently, Bellingham, an England international, did not play in the forward position he started last season with such devastating goal scoring effect; instead, he was a member of the midfield trio."(Mbappe) has the quality to score a lot of goals," Ancelotti told Movistar."What we have to look for is balance in the team -- today we didn't have that balance."In a close first half, Mbappe's best opportunity came in the fifteenth minute, but Isak Hien expertly blocked his attempt from the middle of the box.After shocking Bayer Leverkusen in the Europa League final the previous season, Gian Piero Gasperini's Atalanta made their Super Cup debut. Eder Militao nearly gave them the lead by heading Marten de Roon's cross over his own bar.Bellingham took a hard touch to control a deft pass from Vinicius and was booked for a late push on Atalanta goalkeeper Juan Musso during a raid forward from midfield.Vinicius set Rodrygo up, and he clipped the top of Atalanta's crossbar right before halftime.At the beginning of the second half, Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, who was injured for the majority of the previous season, made an incredible one-handed save to deflect a header by Mario Pasalic.At the beginning of the second half, Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois, who was injured for the majority of the previous season, made an incredible one-handed save to deflect a header by Mario Pasalic.Before the hour, Valverde of Real Madrid broke the tie with a close-range tap-in as Atalanta's defense fretted over Mbappe's increased freedom of movement.Vinicius, who was becoming more and more important, feed Bellingham, who then sliced the ball across the goal for the Uruguayan midfielder to score.When Vinicius was let through on goal, Musso knocked over his attempt, which would have doubled Madrid's lead.As Madrid attempted a second, Swedish defender Hien stopped Bellingham, and Musso then stopped the former Borussia Dortmund player.Eventually, Mbappe finished it with a deadly flourish after Bellingham stalled an attempt and saw the Frenchman's deft move.The Madrid supporters applauded the striker as Ancelotti took him off the field in the 83rd minute, probably the first of many that to come.Mbappe stated that he anticipated getting better in the upcoming weeks. Real Mallorca will be Madrid's first La Liga opponent on Saturday."I am sure we will get better and me first of all -- but today is a positive step," added the striker.
Article Summary: Kylian Mbappe scored on his Real Madrid debut to help his new team defeat Atalanta 2-0 and win the UEFA Super Cup for the record sixth time. The French forward sensation finally joined Los Blancos this summer upon his departure from Paris Saint-Germain.

Article Title: AIFF's charity match in Manjeri to support Wayanad survivors
Article Text: KOCHI: The All India Football Federation will organise a charity match to raise funds for the relief works for the victims of Wayanad landslides. The match will be held between Kolkata outfit Mohammedan Sporting and a combined XI of the Super League Kerala sides at the Sports Council stadium in Manjeri, Malappuram, on Aug 30."I'm happy that one of India's oldest clubs, Mohammedan Sporting, immediately agreed to our proposal for the cause of humanity.We are also in advance conversation with two clubs for the Lucknow match," said AIFF president Kalyan Chaubey .AIFF has also proposed a second charity match on Sept 2 in Lucknow for the fund collection for the relief works in Himachal Pradesh, where more than 100 people were killed in the past week due to landslides and flash floods triggered by heavy rain at multiple locations. However, further details of this match, including the teams to be played, are not finalised.Meanwhile, AIFF general secretary P Anilkumar said that the relief amount collected from the Manjeri game will be a combined amount which includes the gate collection and contribution from SLK and the franchisees."It would be a day-night game at Manjeri. The amount collected from this match will solely go to the relief works at Wayanad, while the amount from the Lucknow match will be used for Himachal Pradesh," said Anilkumar.However, he also added that a final decision has not been taken on how to distribute the funds. "As for Kerala, the amount collected may be donated to CMDRF most probably. We have not taken a final decision on this," he added.SLK CEO Mathew Joseph, CEO of Super League Kerala, said that the team which will face Mohammedan Sporting will be selected only after Aug 20."Foreign players will be joining their teams only by Aug 20. The team for the charity match will be selected only after that. The SLK technical committee will be selecting the team after consulting with the team owners. It will be a combined team including foreign players and Indians, with one of the six foreign coaches of SLK as the head coach," said Joseph.
Article Summary: The All India Football Federation will organise a charity match to raise funds for the relief works for the victims of Wayanad landslides. The match will be held between Kolkata outfit Mohammedan Sporting and a combined XI of the Super League Kerala sides at the Sports Council stadium in Manjeri, Malappuram, on Aug 30. AIFF has also proposed a second charity match on Sept 2 in Lucknow for the fund collection for the Relief works in Himachal Pradesh.

Article Title: AIFF to organise charity matches for victims affected by Kerala and Himachal floods
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The All India Football Federation has announced plans to hold two charity football matches to support the relief efforts in Kerala and Himachal Pradesh, both of which have been severely affected by natural calamities.The first match is tentatively scheduled for August 30 in Manjeri, located in Kerala's Malappuram district. The game will feature Mohammedan Sporting Club, a prominent team from Kolkata, facing off against a Super League Kerala XI.The AIFF is trying to schedule its first benefit match in Manjeri in Malappuram district of Kerala on August 30 between Kolkata outfit Mohammedan Sporting Club and a Super League Kerala XI.For the second charity match, the AIFF has suggested September 2 as the date and Lucknow as the venue. However, the governing body is still working out the specifics with the potential participating clubs."I'm happy that one of India's oldest clubs, Mohammedan Sporting immediately agreed to our proposal for the cause of humanity. We are also in advance conversation with two clubs for the Lucknow match," said AIFF President, Kalyan Chaubey in a release."Sports is a powerful medium to offer comfort and heal humanity after such tragedies. We often celebrate cups won by clubs; let's now come together to raise the cup of solidarity," the AIFF president said.Kerala and Himachal Pradesh have been grappling with the aftermath of severe natural calamities.On July 30, Wayanad, a district in Kerala, experienced catastrophic landslides that resulted in significant loss of life and extensive damage to infrastructure.The region was left reeling from the devastating impact of these geological events.
Article Summary: The All India Football Federation has announced plans to hold two charity football matches to support the relief efforts in Kerala and Himachal Pradesh. The first match is tentatively scheduled for August 30 in Manjeri, located in Kerala's Malappuram district. The governing body is still working out the specifics with the potential participating clubs.

Article Title: 'Underdogs' East Bengal look to defy odds against Turkmenistan challengers
Article Text: KOLKATA: Carles Cuadrat the realist is saying that East Bengal FC will not start favourites against Turkmenistan 's Altyn Asyr FC in the AFC Champions League preliminary play-off.Cuadrat the believer, however, is ready to embrace this challenge as a new beginning for his team.The match at the Salt Lake Stadium on Wednesday will mark East Bengal's return to Asian football since their AFC Cup group stage exit in 2015.A win in this one-off fixture will fetch them a place in the first-ever ACL 2 edition while a defeat will take them to the Challenge Cup, the lowest in the AFC club tournament system.Aware of the stakes, Cuadrat described it as a "difficult test" for his players. "We'll play against a team that is showing why they deserve to be in an AFC competition year after year as they've qualified for top 9AFC) competitions every season. It'll be a good test for us to prove that we are also at that kind of level and can represent the country in a top competition like the ACL-2," the Spanish coach told reporters on Tuesday."We are not favourites for this game. We are playing in Asia after 9 years and have a lot of inexperienced players. It will be the first game (in an Asian tournament) for some of our players. But one thing is clear is that East Bengal will play with a never-say-die attitude and we'll hope to take advantage of our home crowd," he added.Cuadrat has had the experience of facing the Turkmenistan rivals. During his stint with Bengaluru FC back in 2018, Sunil Chhetri & Co. lost the two-legged AFC Cup inter-zonal semifinals 5-2 on aggregate.Never a man fond of beating the drum for revenge, Cuadrat, however, will take on Altyn Asyr at a challenging time. The senior team's pre-season is just two competitive match-old with the all-important derby against Mohun Bagan SG coming up in four days time with the Durand Cup quarterfinal spot at stake. Players like Hector Yuste are yet to join the side while a few others are nursing injuries.Yet, amid the euphoria of India defender Anwar Ali's unveiling during the club's Sports Day ceremony later in the day, Cuadrat knows that his team can announce the arrival of its new-found ambitions with a win over Altyn Asyr."We want to raise the standards. We reached two finals last season and were not so good in the ISL. We want to be the protagonist in all the competitions we want to play this season," the East Bengal coach remarked.For a team founded only in 2008, winning Turkmenistan's top domestic league (Yokary Liga) 8 times and being a regular in Asian football speaks volumes of Altyn Asyr's emergence as a force to reckon with.The visitors from Turkmenistan have the form and history on their side. But the red-and-gold's history is replete with many odds-defying tales. It remains to be seen if Nandhakumar Sekar & Co., starting as underdogs, can rise to the occasion and alter the script.
Article Summary: East Bengal face Turkmenistan's Altyn Asyr FC in AFC Champions League preliminary play-off. Match will mark East Bengal's return to Asian football since their AFC Cup group stage exit in 2015. A win in this one-off fixture will fetch them a place in the first-ever ACL 2 edition. A defeat will take them to the Challenge Cup, the lowest in the AFC club tournament system.

Article Title: Alexander Zverev clinches 50th win of season at Cincinnati Open
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Germany's Alexander Zverev showcased his dominance on Thursday at the Cincinnati Open , dispatching Karen Khachanov in straight sets (6-3, 6-2) to secure his first-round victory . This win marks a significant milestone for Zverev, making him the first player on the ATP Tour to reach 50 victories in the 2024 season.The match, lasting 78 minutes, saw Zverev dictate play from the baseline, striking 16 winners to Khachanov's nine.Despite a brief rain delay in the second set, the German remained unfazed, maintaining his composure and aggressive style. This victory extends Zverev's head-to-head record against Khachanov to 5-2.This year has been particularly fruitful for Zverev, who previously triumphed in Cincinnati back in 2021. He has consistently achieved the 50-win milestone throughout his career, reaching it in 2017, 2018, 2021, and 2023.His 2024 season already includes a sixth ATP Masters 1000 title earned in Rome, and he enters the Cincinnati Open as the third seed, harboring aspirations for another title run.Zverev's 50-15 win-loss record places him firmly atop the leaderboard for most wins this season. Trailing behind him are Jannik Sinner (45-5), Casper Ruud (44-13), and Carlos Alcaraz (38-7).A strong performance in Cincinnati would further solidify Zverev's position in the ATP Live Race To Turin, where he currently sits in third place. As a two-time champion of the prestigious year-end ATP Finals, Zverev will be aiming to leverage his current form into a successful qualification bid.Zverev's next challenge in Cincinnati will be against the winner of the match between Australia's Max Purcell and Spain's Pablo Carreno Busta.
Article Summary: Alexander Zverev defeated Karen Khachanov in straight sets (6-3, 6-2) at the Cincinnati Open. This win marks a significant milestone for the German, making him the first player on the ATP Tour to reach 50 victories in the 2024 season. He has consistently achieved the 50-win milestone throughout his career, reaching it in 2017, 2018, 2021 and 2023.

Article Title: Jannik Sinner, Iga Swiatek advance at Cincinnati Open
Article Text: Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek , the top seeds at the Cincinnati Open, emerged victorious in their respective opening matches on Wednesday. However, Swiatek faced a tough challenge from French qualifier Varvara Gracheva in the second round.Despite dominating the first set in just 22 minutes, WTA world number one Swiatek struggled to close out the match when leading 5-2 in the second set.Gracheva, ranked 62nd, saved five match points and capitalized on her own fifth set point to force a deciding set.In the men's draw, ATP number one Sinner fended off eight break points as he kicked off his Cincinnati Open campaign with a 6-4, 7-5 victory over American qualifier Alex Michelsen.Swiatek managed to compose herself in the final set, ultimately securing the hard-fought win to advance to the third round. The match lasted over two hours, with Swiatek requiring six match points to seal the deal.The Cincinnati Open serves as the last major tournament before the US Open, making it a crucial event for players to fine-tune their game ahead of the Grand Slam."It was not easy to finish in the second set," Swiatek said, as quoted by AFP. "She started playing with freedom, with nothing to lose. "I backed down a bit and she used her chances. I'm happy I got more proactive in the third set and played more intense.""I knew I had the game to win it -- I did have five match points," she said. "It was my fault that I didn't close it out, but that happens."I was able to play the third like I did at the start of the match. I don't want any regrets. I'm only looking forward. I'm in a peaceful place and I'm playing without expectations."Sinner, the Italian tennis prodigy who will celebrate his 23rd birthday on Friday, is determined to surpass his previous best performance at the American Midwest tournament, where he has never advanced beyond the third round.The top-seeded player is optimistic about his chances this week.Sinner, who needed just under two hours to secure his victory, became the first man to reach the third round of the tournament. This triumph marked his 25th win on hardcourt surfaces this season.Since his last defeat before the quarter-final stage at the Masters 1000 event in Shanghai in October of the previous year, Sinner has consistently reached the latter stages of every tournament he has participated in.In the match, Sinner's teenage opponent, Michelsen, struggled with his consistency, committing 42 unforced errors. Michelsen managed to hit only 14 winners, which was precisely half the number Sinner achieved."It was a tough match," Sinner said. "I needed to start feeling the conditions and getting used to them. I'm very happy to be into the next round. I've struggled here in past years. But today I stayed positive and that helped in the win."Sinner couldn't participate in the Paris Olympics because of tonsillitis."I'm not yet at 100%, but the main goal is the US Open," he said. "I have one week (after Cincinnati) to prepare in the best possible way. The matches I can play here will help at the Open."Stefanos Tsitsipas, the ninth seed, made his debut appearance since parting ways with his father as his coach last week. The Greek player staged a remarkable comeback, defeating Jan-Lennard Struff 4-6, 6-4, 6-3 to advance to the second round.Casper Ruud, the seventh seed from Norway, secured a 6-3, 6-1 victory over American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic. He will face Felix Auger-Aliassime in the next round.Alexei Popyrin, the recent champion in Montreal, suffered a 7-5, 6-3 loss to France's Gael Monfils in his opening match.Holger Rune of Denmark prevailed over Matteo Berrettini with a score of 2-6, 6-1, 6-4, putting an end to the Italian's impressive 10-match winning streak, which included clay court titles in Gstaad and Kitzbuehel.British player Jack Draper endured a grueling battle lasting over two and a half hours to overcome Spain's Jaume Munar 7-5, 3-6, 7-6 (7/5).In the women's draw, Paula Badosa, who is in a relationship with Tsitsipas, progressed to the second round after securing a 6-2, 7-5 win against local player Peyton Stearns from Cincinnati.
Article Summary: Top seeds Jannik Sinner and Iga Swiatek advance to the second round of the Cincinnati Open. Sinner defeated American qualifier Alex Michelsen 6-4, 7-5 in the men's draw. WTA world number one Swiatesk defeated French qualifier Varvara Gracheva 6-3, 6-2.

Article Title: I have resigned as Davis Cup coach: Zeeshan Ali
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Zeeshan Ali declared his resignation from the role of Indian Davis Cup team coach on Wednesday, just a month prior to the squad's upcoming tie against Sweden, which is set to take place in Stockholm."I have resigned as the coach of the Davis Cup team," Zeeshan Ali told PTI.In 2013, Zeeshan, then 54, took over as coach of the team, replacing Nandan Bal , just before the match against South Korea in New Delhi."I've been coach of the Davis Cup team for 11 years now. To top it all, I was also the captain of the Davis Cup, the historic tie that we played against Pakistan in Pakistan earlier on this year. I don't think there is any such person from any country who has had the privilege and honor of doing all these three things," he said."There have been players who were captains, but I don't think there has been a situation where the player was a coach and then the coach was also the captain of the team."So having done all these three things, I felt that I have already achieved whatever there was to achieve as far as Davis Cup was concerned. And frankly speaking, I have been thinking about this for quite some time now."India is set to face Sweden on a hard indoor court in Stockholm from September 14-15.
Article Summary: Zeeshan Ali declares his resignation from the role of Indian Davis Cup team coach. Ali took over as coach of the team in 2013, replacing Nandan Bal. India is set to face Sweden on a hard indoor court in Stockholm from September 14-15.

Article Title: Australian Alexei Popyrin makes history with ATP Montreal Masters title win
Article Text: Alexei Popyrin achieved the biggest triumph of his tennis career on Monday by clinching the ATP Montreal Masters title with a commanding 6-2, 6-4 victory over Andrey Rublev . The Australian, ranked world number 62, secured the prestigious Masters 1000 title in just 90 minutes, capitalizing on Rublev's mental struggles.This win marks a historic achievement as Popyrin becomes the first Australian to win a Masters 1000 title since Lleyton Hewitt 's 2003 victory at Indian Wells.Popyrin, 25, joins an elite group of Australians who have won at this level, including Patrick Rafter, Mark Philippoussis, and Hewitt. The significance of his victory was evident in his emotional reflection on the achievement."This means so much, it means the world. All the hard work we've put in over the last couple of years has paid off. Everyone around me has sacrificed so much of their lives for me. For me to win this for them is amazing," Popyrin was quoted as saying by AFP.Popyrin's journey to the title is remarkable. He defeated five top-20 opponents, including world number six Rublev. Rublev, who has struggled with mental stress and on-court frustrations this season, could not maintain the form that saw him defeat world number one Jannik Sinner in the quarterfinals.Rublev's frustrations were evident early in the match. He struggled to find his rhythm and let his temper get the better of him. Popyrin took full advantage, breaking Rublev's serve twice in the first set and maintaining his composure to close it out convincingly.In the second set, Popyrin continued to apply pressure, breaking Rublev early. Although Rublev briefly leveled the score, Popyrin quickly regained control and sealed the match with a powerful forehand winner on his third match point.With the tennis world turning its attention to the upcoming US Open, Popyrin's stunning performance in Montreal has established him as a player to watch.
Article Summary: Alexei Popyrin becomes the first Australian to win a Masters 1000 title since Lleyton Hewitt's 2003 victory at Indian Wells. The 25-year-old beat world number six Andrey Rublev 6-2, 6-4 in just 90 minutes. The win marks the biggest triumph of his tennis career.

Article Title: Jessica Pegula wins second consecutive WTA Toronto Masters title
Article Text: Jessica Pegula triumphed over Amanda Anisimova with a score of 6-3, 2-6, 6-1 in the WTA Toronto Masters final on Monday. This win marked Pegula's second consecutive title at this event, last achieved by Martina Hingis in 1999-2000.Pegula, the sixth-ranked player, secured her sixth WTA title overall and her second of the year, following her success in Berlin in June.According to AFP, Pegula maintained her unbeaten record against Anisimova by winning this match, having previously defeated her in Charleston earlier this year.The final match began with Pegula breaking Anisimova's serve in the opening game. Pegula continued strong, clinching the first set in 27 minutes, helped by a double fault from Anisimova.In the second set, Anisimova turned the tables by breaking Pegula with a powerful forehand winner to take a 2-1 lead.
